data.question: What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: Guest-controlled incommensurate modulation in a meta-rigid metal-organic framework material

data.question: What method was used for in situ infrared spectroscopy experiments?
What is the BET surface area of MFM-520?
What gas shows a notably higher isothermal uptake at low pressure in MFM-520?
Is the structure of MFM-520 affected by adsorbed CO2 molecules?
What is the crystallographic uptake of SO2 in MFM-520 at 270 K and 1.0 bar?
Can the SO2-saturated MFM-520 be readily regenerated solely via a pressure swing?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for SO2 adsorption at low surface coverage in MFM-520?
Does MFM-520 show high selectivity for SO2 under flue gas desulfurization conditions?
What is the dynamic adsorption selectivity of SO2/N2 in MFM-520 at 298 K?
What is the formal oxidation state of all Zn(II) centers in MFM-520Â·H2O?
What is the effect of SO2 adsorption on the modulation vectors in MFM-520?
data.answer: SO2 adsorption changes the modulation vectors, indicating a unique incommensurately ordered dynamic equilibrium.

data.question: Is the periodic-to-aperiodic phase transition in MFM-520 reversible?
What is the selectivity factor for SO2/CO2 mixtures in MFM-520 at 298 K?
What is the main application of MFM-520 as demonstrated in the research?
data.answer: Capture, storage, and conversion of SO2

data.question: Does MFM-520 undergo irreversible phase change at low temperatures?
What is the role of sulfur dioxide in the research?
data.answer: SO2 plays a key role in demonstrating the reversible adsorption and structural modulation within MFM-520.

data.question: Can MFM-520 be used for the selective removal of SO2 from flue gas?
What is the impact of temperature on the modulation vectors of dehydrated MFM-520?
data.answer: No change was observed in the modulation vectors for dehydrated MFM-520 between 180 and 350 K.

data.question: What is the significance of the incommensurate modulation observed in MFM-520?
data.answer: The incommensurate modulation signifies a new type of framework flexibility in crystalline porous solids.
